FfYdaPtQzEV_gmdbOmrgbQ.text: Been coming here for many years.  Although the food has had slight ups and downs I would have to say that overall it's never disappointing and the people are always very nice.  I want to give it 5 stars but I think 90% is a solid summation of my experiences here.  If your new in town this is definitely a must visit and should be a staple for a great lunch dinner or happy hour.  I order the fajitas steamed instead of with oil so it's healthier and only had an issue once getting it that way out of the kitchen (hence the 90%). It's much better that way to me.  Chips and salsa are dangerously good and they are pretty generous with them. I try to exercise self control but they usually defeat me.  Enjoy!

-jXBtaFyfL9t5-FOTnt-eg.text: My friend and I frequent this restaurant for lunch at least once a month. Food is yummy, but we've had two instances now where the waiter didn't give back the correct change. Last time, she reported it to the manager and today it happened again. Seems like this may be a way that servers there make some extra $.  Pathetic and not sure we'll be back. If you go, make sure you use a card to pay...and check your bill.

ap9nXP5qFOfhQii_KXPZcw.text: Found this little gem by accident. It was the best accident ever! Such delicious food! So fresh and well prepared. The ambiance is perfect for a late lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Ajo Al's Mexican Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fancy logo.

EUv4FlRwZoEmkTI_YYEZnA.text: Vegetarians beware- All sauces are made with chicken stock, even on the mushroom enchilada which is described as vegetarian. (Neither the rice nor refried beans are vegetarian either.  They did have a black bean option, but no rice option.)  They were able to accommodate by just using cheese, no sauce.  Service was pretty good.

2V-s2KZ3irmLGOovDfBUPg.text: Solid.  Pollo con queso, shrimp fajitas, and carnitas tacos.  Everyone enjoyed their meals.  The chips and salsa were great.  Great service.  What more can you ask for.   Looking forward to a return trip and try some of their other items.  Thumps AND forks up!

3I2r5fw-iNa93GLzoJyryw.text: Drove all the way from Gilbert to this place because of the good reviews and that the presidents go here. Was very disappointed in the food. Chips and salsa were not great and the food was just edible. Ordered everything from burritos to fajitas to the steak salad. The steak was hard and overcooked and the food was over salted. On the Border makes better food than this place. Never again. The chicken also is like a rotisserie chicken. Gross.

qGBR4le1kbVKFF_sBEZQcg.text: After a year of lamenting that Phoenix's Mexican Food scene is nowhere near the caliber of Southern Cal's (where I moved from), my husband and I are done with searching and lamenting! It is just so yummy. I am a creature of habit and get the Pollo Con Queso every time, and I highly recommend it. It's huge, so luckily it tastes exactly as good re-heated the next day. Maybe even better. If there was anything that could improve, the milder salsa is served in a mini carafe that has to get poured onto your chips directly, which can get messy. But it's really no big deal. And they'd probably give me a little bowl if i asked, I just never have. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try!

uzQze2Kj3yeGthwIb3DmnA.text: Ok this is how my evening started:My friend Katy and I walked into Aunt Chilada's restaurant At Squaw Peak on 6/28/2014 to have a awesome dinner. The place had a few parties going on, but as usual it seemed under staffed. So my friend and I sat down and we were given chips and salsa and a bottle of water. About 5-10 minutes later a family came in with small children and after about another 5 minutes or so,  all of sudden a waiter comes out and looked me right in the eye and went to the other table and took their order. Turned around and went back in to the kitchen. Of course this pissed me off. We got up and hostess saw me I explained what happen she said it was her fault. That did not make it OK. The waiter should have said something to us and didn't. So we left Aunt Chilada's in discuss and went down the road to Ajo Al's for a awesome meal and great service..  So now we are at Ajo Al's for the first time and I was speechless when I walked out. The service was outstanding our waitress was Theresa who was very professional & friendly. And the food was excellent. As another Yelper  - Steve V was right about the Cheese Queso Dip it was very tasty.  I will be going back to Ajo Al's again soon.

P9zDbYNnziU0bsWPwU4Cug.text: We had a work lunch there today. Food was great service was amazing. There were 26 people in our group. Everyone was very pleased with their meal. Server even split our bills!

yEfPF09VWGzTTqWktbUvCw.text: We've been going to Ajo Al's for over 12 years now and we have never been disappointed.   The food is great, the service is excellent the prices are very reasonable and its our home away from home.  The queso dip is our favorite and we would swim in it if they'd let us. We would highly recommend this place your next Fiesta!

4nN-0WZEUVonCEzocoPtQw.text: Disappointing.  We used to come here once a week.  They changed he red chili recipe and the beans taste like they are out of a can.  You used to be great!  Stop cutting corners.

IzIot-VglPaqZdAZ6jFmNQ.text: What a shame this place has gone into the toilet.  Firat i ordered eggs and the homemade chorizo.  5 mi utes later the waitress came back to say they forgot to tell her there was no chorizo.  It was homemade.  Then my daughter ordered the shrimp fajitas.  The shrimp were not cleaned properly.  Disgusting.  They offered to remake it and that took anither 20 minutes.  Beans were bad.  Clearly they are canned.  Rice tasted old too.  Avoid at all cost.

G-2V4rDjYWQzC7ddhAIJ8w.text: An update to my last review.  I am very happy to hear from the owner that they will be bring back their red chilli.  I am looking forward to visiting Ajo Al's again.

RpnngnuBSqm9cO5XBYqMsA.text: Have had lunch here several times as this is one of my co-workers favorite places. It's your typical Mexican fare, not bad, sort of greasy, average to slightly above average. Parking is good, the facilities are clean and they have a large bar.

rkO0hDJ6z0Rp8REnmVha-g.text: Love their shreaded beef burro and wonderful chips and salsa wonderful employees great environment

A-7SA-7dD-yW7oNfVYIa7w.text: Great food. My husband took me for a late lunch at 1:30 and the place was empty so we had awesome service.  Fresh chips, hot and mild salsa and my husband's favorite the jalapeno ranch. I had the Carne Asada burro Dinner with beef. And it was packed with beef. My husband had the lunch E which was the Paco Pollo Con Queso  (Chicken and cheese) very good. So we spilt each in half and enjoyed.

rhS83VtI5pGCuL4qEEZcPQ.text: I eat here often when in town and almost always it's good value. Usually I have carne asada burro, but tonight had cheese enchiladas in red sauce. Only three bites though. Too salty to eat. The burro is great - can't recommend the enchiladas.

lPD9q0b12ou31OoxvAzV9w.text: The food is always fresh and delicious at Ajo Al's on 16th Street. I've dined here plenty of times. January 14, 2016 last night at 7:45pm, I ordered the Mexican Stack; its a Lasagna of a Mexican entree. #Delicious! The only issue is in my most recent visit, the bartender was not attentive. When I arrived it took 15 mins before she even said, hello. Then she asked if I wanted to place an order, but never offered a menu. Well how can, I place an order if I don't have a menu to review the 'ah so many choices. Therefore I had to ask for a menu.  Next I had to ask for the warm complinary chips and salsa. While in the past, I've dined here plenty of times before,  I've always been offered chips and salsa. Or it was immediately brought out to me. When the chips where finally brought out, I adked for a side of guacamole. Which took another 18 mins. Then I watched her immediately serve new customers....Whom received prompt service,  chips and salsa,  menus delivered without asking....All customers should be treated with the same prompt attention and respect. It is from the every customer that keeps such restaurants in business. It is the customer's verbal and written reviews that a multitude of other customers will read. The irony is, it only takes one employee (bartender last night)@ Ajo Al's to give customers a bad experience.

6v82VNa-xsqn9xhqn4dxkQ.text: Very fun place with attentive and pleasant waitstaff. Good food and margaritas for sure.

BjKJjZX0q0syIz8Dgqbzkg.text: I'd like to give this place zero stars, but that is not an option. I used to go here and like it, until about a month ago when I went in on a weekend day for lunch and got a nasty surprise.   I ordered my usual - shredded beef tacos.  I took one of the two home as I can never finish all my food.  Later I went to eat the other one for dinner and when biting down, bit into a rock hard "something" that cracked my tooth.  I spit it out, put it in a bag and went back to the restaurant to complain.  My server and an Asst Mgr looked at it and determined it was a piece of bone that came from a mistake a cook made while shaving meat off the bone.  I was promised the owner would contact me to discuss the situation and my injury.  Days passed and nothing. I went back in person again - was again promised a phone call.  Days passed and nothing.  I called a few days later and was told the same thing over the phone.  Days passed and well you get it by now - nothing!  I went in person one last time to tell the person at the hostess stand that I was disgusted by how I was being treated.    She told me the owner was out of town now for several weeks.  I told her that almost everyone has a cell phone and if he cared even a little for how a patron of his restaurant was impacted by the food I was served, he'd find a way to get off his ass and call me.  She just looked at me.   This place should be SHUT DOWN immediately. Food safety and customer safety is obviously of no concern here.  Eating here is at your own risk.    Mr. wonderful owner will be hearing from me soon - when I sue him in small claims court.  Had he been a decent human being, we could have resolved this so much easier.

HPcDEwg5DBcph_Fg6Zt--Q.text: I came to this location about 10 years ago and it was kind of blah. We barely gave it another try and I was quite impressed. Andrew was our server and he took excellent care of us. I had the chicken soup, which it was not my favorite because I like my soups with no spices, but the cheese appetizer was excellent, and also the machaca chimi that my hubby had.

uz0lTts-HHHHd5_J-LMIQQ.text: Wow! Great service and food is amazing, plate comes hot, but food comes hotter! Yum!  Mushroom enchiladas with Steak, hibiscus margarita, great dips!

photos.caption: Photo of Ajo Al's Mexican Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VIFFXgkjWlVS_B0EAhXMsg.text: Love the Chips and Salsa!!! Always eat toooo much. And great service. Ask for Breanna!!!

FROp-5pWdqrIuEuUdPUu0Q.text: Oh man! This place was pretty cool. Loved the artwork too. Went for all day happy hour on Monday and the food and service was great! Our waitress Bree recommended the margaritas and they were amazing! Definitely ask for her when you go!

huskUcCY20a8vy0XP2l5wg.text: First time there in a long time and wasn't disappointed. The waitress was exceptional . The food came out very presentable and very hot from the cheese crisp ( all the cheese melted and crispy) to the main entree enchilada, beans and rice all hot. The chips were okay but the salsas were above average.

aH1oKxEaL7IVsNsGlI43Yg.text: We have been coming to Ajo Als for over 8 years, it's a family favorite in our house. The pollo con queso is my personal favorite, and the leftovers are just as good for lunch the next day. The owners are amazing and so is the staff, only had poor service one time and the manager fixed the issue no problem! Great service and food also seating available for larger parties!

wTcaizT0X4lTsnyYQJUCWA.text: Great service recommend the prickly pear margarita ...for a great server ask for breanna

7dyqbaXt50WlHuZSX0HTxA.text: Awesome Mexican Food!   I love the mushroom enchiladas with black beans and rice!!!  I've ordered other meals too and it's always delicious!!!  It is hands down one of the BEST places to go for Mexican Food in Phoenix!

w-_AuarLTylLcFDYi_ybOA.text: I had heard of Ajo Al's, but never been there. I was staying overnight in a hotel within walking distance and decided to try it out. I made it over for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised. I was able to order an appetizer and 2 house margaritas for $10.50. Both the food and drinks were good, especially for the price. Nothing seemed spectacular, just standard Americanized Mexican food, but the happy hour pricing was definitely worth while. I sat at the bar, and the service was wonderful. Bree was alone in the bar and was hustling nonstop. She had a lot of customers, plus the restaurant drinks, but everyone received plenty of attention. She was a huge plus to the experience. I look forward to coming back next time I'm in the area.

F2gh76rv7Kf4tBlEHGNjFw.text: Typical chain Mexican food restaurant, nothing stands out as 'authentic', it's more Americanized.  The prices are not at all reasonable for chain Mexican food however, which is one main reason for rating it as two stars.  The service both times we have been here is sub-par, despite not being busy.   Happy hour is the only time I would recommend eating here as the prices are reasonable and the items are fairly good.

CqcbDhTZi0tkIJ3-LSn85A.text: Delicious! The bar has a great atmosphere. The happy hour menu has so much on it, plus it's ALL DAY happy hour on Mondays. I had the flautas and the bean dip and my husband had the tacos morongo. Definitely will be back.

Z1cUZsfi-Wr8SjQqOwd1mg.text: Very solid place for some good Mexican food.  The white sauce chicken enchiladas are great!  Autumn helped us out and provided great service as well.  We will be back.

Bmkx60PaafmoD4hhFVcSFw.text: Stopped by after being picked up at Sky Harbor by my parents. Too quiet for a Friday night. Hard to wreck a cheese crisp but somehow they pulled it off. Dry rice and very weak chips. Someone needs to get a handle on the kitchen before the reputation continues to tumble.

joRFNgq1IsUWnqyjPk22iQ.text: We have been looking for a good Mexican restaurant for a while now and a friend highly recommended Ajo Al's. We went around 4pm on a Saturday and it wasn't very busy when we arrived. SUPER nice waitress named either Christy or Christine (I forget) suggested the skinny margarita since it's made with real lime. Tasted like the ones we get in Mexico (YUM!). The green corn tamales and Chile rellenos were outstanding. We will be back..... next time we're trying the fried ice cream everyone is recommending.  Well we went back again and it was once again outstanding. Had a frozen mango margarita which was delicious, and the shrimp pork belly tacos were to die for. We were served by another great server, Brianna Lopez, who took the time to talk to us and took care of our every need. Recommending this restaurant to everyone!!

AR8B7xeot04juAYsLh6UaQ.text: Ajo Al's is my favorite Mexican food eatery. And Miss Christina is my favorite server. She has personality plus. She is so accommodating and very efficient. If I had a restaurant, I would steal her away. You're very lucky to have such a pleasant server.

k3IlJu8DDJop9eFec8vmfw.text: Wow what a night! Stopped by after quite a while. After starting the evening by the bar I noticed something missing! The main artwork that hung for 20 plus years. The way I noticed this was on the way out of the bathroom. Upon asking the bartender about the "dog" artwork and who made the decision to move it by the bathrooms vs. in the main area. The bartender responded the owner, and then indicated that he/ she was here now.  A man that was standing around doing nothing responded that he was said owner and the art was moved after they got "bored of it". Mind you this art hung in the same place for 20 plus years and was a staple of this location. After hearing that I made a comment about another location changing the art because they were "bored of it" and he seemingly shut down. He again asserted his position as owner to which I responded he is the owners son and not the owner. He did not like this. He did however like how my family and I paid for his house payments for 20 plus years of dining at this restaurant. Next I stated is was "weird" that they would change an iconic piece of AZ art to near the bathroom to which this "owner" responded: "I am sure you have seen more weird stuff than that."  Wait what? Who are you talkin to? I am a business owner Not a business owners kid first of all! How dare you take it personal on a customer? I say back: Are you trying to disrespect me? How are you gonna make assumptions about what I have seen being I am in an AZ/ Mexican restaurant with what used to be good food and this type of terrible service.  Next thing dude is standing behind the bar actin tough askin me to leave? Seriously? Who are you but a child of a moderately successful restaurant in AZ. I have been away for a couple years from this establishment and since then the children took over and are running a very good AZ brand into the ground.  If you want better food and way better service go to La Pinata on 7th ave and Missouri Or go to Phoenix Burrito House on 7th ave and Indian School rd.  Get the cheese enchiladas.   * Update: Let us all be clear and transparent here, the response you read here by "Patrick, the owners son" is completely 180 degrees opposite of the response he offered in person the other night. Hypocritical to say the least. If he had Not taken the discussion to a personal level making a comment about my personal life then I would have happily accepted that it Is and Was the owners decision to do whatever they please with the art. What is Not acceptable is when this "manager/ owner" felt it necessary to take things personal.  My question back to you Patrick is: why did you attempt to disrespect me in front of the entire bar of customers and your staff? That is why I pointed that your absolutely Not the owner, rather your the owners kid. Patrick, if you have something to say like a man then you walk over and ask me to step aside and say it then. You chose Yelp to act like you were above the situation but really you caused the problem by smiling behind the bar acting like my opinion did Not matter vs. accepting that a long time customer may have a valid position. I will say this my father taught me to be a better man so I walked away before Patricks mouth wrote a check he could not cash on his best day.  So back to you Patrick, what did I miss?

0qqguOtbgRux-znw6tdb_A.text: Really wanted our experience and food to be more than bleh, but it was bleh. Had the Pollo con Queso which was good.  Hadn't been here in a while.   Place smells a little musty and looks a little run down. Needs a refresh.  Used to be great food and great place to hang out.

5O-viG9IIqa7jtYlKQHa4g.text: Good experience unfortunately marred by not honoring our original reservation.   I must say first that the food was very good and our waiter was excellent and friendly. Kudos to him. But we had a family reunion planned and reserved the semi-private room in the back. We called in again later to confirm that we would get that room. But when we arrived tonight, we found that they had already given the room to a different group. No one at Ajo Al's bothered to call and tell us this. Had we known, we would have gone somewhere else with our big group of kids, adults, and seniors. Since we were such a big group and had to sit in the main room with all the noise and being very spread out, we didn't get to interact as much as we would have liked. We made it work, but we are very disappointed that the management let this happen.

GVD-Cw_MnCEY0iiy1jLcfA.text: Christina is my server when I go to Ajo Al's. She is just fabulous. Always remembers my order.  Always cheerful. A real asset to Ajo Al's.  She's the best and definitely deserves a salary increase and/or a promotion.

oFMG1IaPr1O0JFIu-dboGA.text: Fantastic food, love this place!  Really enjoy the changes they have made to presentation.

bR1FhRRoruDJKAUwe9srnw.text: I am not sure why everyone loves this place so much.   I went here many years ago and I liked it better then.   Chips were good, salsa was tasty but not very spicy.  I asked our server whether the red or green chile was spicier.  He stated the salsa was hotter than either of them.  I am glad he was honest but I was a little disappointed.  I had the spinach enchiladas which were actually quite tasty.  Wait staff was very attentive.    It's not terrible, but I like my mexican food with a little sting to it!

h5VfbzHe1OyfBt89Ofxs4g.text: I've passed this place several times and finally ate there. I've been twice now and the food is decent. The pomegranate margaritas are awesome! They have a good selection of things and are usually quick with service. It's not amazing but its been pretty good both times.

YFAkVr1mKQkhl_4J5mkNtA.text: Clean, no wait and plenty of parking but that's where the positive stopped. Service was insultingly slow, food was  luke warm and ooverly sally...won't be back..

iRWiFPVgz4t-sQ95Ro8EZg.text: Ajo Als rocks, but this location is hit and miss.  For some reason their chips are consistently not as good as the other locations - it's like they are soaked in grease.  If you can go to either of the Scottsdale locations, you are better off, based on my experiences.  The pollo con queso is great!!! It's the best thing on the menu if you don't care about calories (deep fried chicken burro, smothered in cream cheese and cheddar cheese, mmmmmmm).  If I don't want 2,000 calories in one meal, I go for the Salad Carbone with Chicken.  It's seriously one of the best salads I have ever had.  They marinade the chicken in something wonderful, it's so tender and flavorful, and served with the best jalapeno ranch. !Muy bueno!

2Qrez8lfpwqT0VkBbEg5Uw.text: I have always went to this location because it's right next to my house, and  have always liked the food. I went  today and the food was terrible so was the service. My food was overcooked and the chips were really hard. My husband got the wrong food and the waitress was irritated that we said anything about the mistake. We had to wait 20 minutes for them to remake the food, and no I'm sorry I screwed up the order. Will not be going back there ever! again.

V0EKKN9F7f_PLJG1Tw2OVA.text: I live super close to here so I've gone along with friends when they invite me, but every time I end up regretting it. Their chips & salsa are good but I have yet to have a good meal or drink here. My friends say their margaritas suck, and the food often comes out lukewarm. The service is slow and the servers often forget things and don't check on you very often. I'll continue avoiding this place.

fsyCfHQzf3U2IWeUbU9i1w.text: Went here for lunch today.  The chips and salsa were terrible.  I ordered the steak fajitas.  The meat was good, but the veggies were burnt beyond recognition.  Good service.  Too expensive for quality of food.  I'd rather go to Macayos or Filibertos.

3JyEBd6iN9WvLv-nDFO3Cw.text: I enjoy going here although it is far from authentic Mexican cuisine. You gotta get the mushroom brown sauce it's killer. I enjoy combo number eight with the brown sauce added. Stay away from all of the chicken dishes they are bland and dry.

44l8lPp77fJuvlEe7atVLA.text: While Ajo Al's easily holds the crown for most bearable tex-mex food in town, imho, I still am a far cry from a big fan of here.   One of my best friends LOVES this place. LOVES it. And I could never figure out why, but I have since turned him onto El Molino in Scottsdale and I haven't heard much about Ajo Al's lately, so maybe he just didn't know any better.  Also, I did hear murmurings of trouble with health code violations here a few months back. Those usually don't scare me too much, in all candor, since perfectly good restarants get the whistle blown on them for relatively minor infractions so often that I've grown somewhat callous to their warnings.   Further, I'm sure any problem that once existed is now long gone since there was some press about the incident when it happened.   A good after work place to grab a drink or watch the game with friends, but do yourself a favor and grab some authentic mexican that us Phoenicians are blessed with when it comes time to eat.

SofbhJXAGDGhGAv6X-hVkA.text: Overall, the food is good but truly NOT mexican in the real sense of the word. It is generally well served but if you do request to hold the cheese in the burrito or omelette,do count of having it included since the chef/cook does NOT pay attention to the orders given. The coffee is flavored and NOT the requested regular coffee. The staff truly didn't care about the fact fact that you requested and pay for regular coffee and NOT hazelnut flavored coffee drinks. I would consider/ think twice before going there again.

2J7Q5f_kmvsJdtGAoUDwxg.text: Not a bad place.... It is defiantly more tex-mex than authentic... but they have Mexican beer, margaritas and is in a good location.

EWeWb42-mpO77GTk1B4PAw.text: I have been going to this place for years, but have been slacking lately... so I returned a couple of weeks ago. I was craving a chicken taco salad, and remembered how great theirs was. It is served in a tortilla bowl, and while I suppose you could eat the bowl, I don't... and go straight for the chicken...and there is plenty of chicken.. which is quite filling. It is shredded chicken on top of fresh greens, cheese, tomato, and a black olive or two. I had the italian dressing with my salad and my friend had the jalapeno ranch. We were both happy. The chips are hot and crispy, and the salsa is good. While I normally go during the week around happy hour time, I went on a Sunday afternoon. The service is great, the place is nice, and the bathrooms are clean, My favorite server was always Myra...but I'm not sure is she is there any longer.I will have to go back and check!

xsJgw4324fPpRZRzguzn6A.text: I dig this place. It's the closest thing to a sure thing in the area for me as far as Mexican food is concerned. The shrimp fajitas rock, as do the fish tacos, which are made with grilled pacific Hawaiian Ono - I think they come with corn tortillas, but they'll gladly trade those out for flour if you ask nice. They also come with a super tasty chipotle cream dipping sauce, but not enough in my opinion. Ask for more, they'll bring it. For vegetarians I recommend the mushroom enchiladas blancas or the spinach enchiladas, both of which are equally delicious - and rich. Bring the Lactaid if you're lactose intolerant. Oh, and apparently they've got a killer lunch menu - not sure how I've been going there for years and didn't know that. Oh, well, maybe it's because I usually go for dinner. Margarita ordering tip: go for broke. The base margarita blows. Yeah, it's way cheaper, but it tastes like you're drinking pure sweet & sour mix. Order their top shelf, whatever it is, I don't remember, think I had one too many last time I was there.

hxHkMjWMrQbbwLLF_b4zyg.text: Cheap, greasy, large portions , fun...... a good place to hang and take mom for dinner...

7pnmiU-RpM-SrEN19HKU9w.text: Fajitas are bomb & love the drinks!! Chips and salsa are good also especially the red hot one. Over all one of our family favs!!

_bPuMNcG9LLnz9j5E9DbLA.text: Walked in at 9:40 on a Saturday and the bartender before we even sat down told us, "just to let you know we close in 15 minutes" so we left... talk about feeling unwanted? To Ariba we go! It's right around the corner!

hXGdQUjZBkPvUe6Gt5AQRA.text: Excellent food. Got takeout and it was a great meal. Friendly staff. No complaints.  Thank you!

d0EGEfoO-R_lwqmpRh4OtQ.text: We love the food here. Pork belly and shrimp tacos were delicious. Food took a while but when it came it was hot and fresh and delicious. Nice portion sizes and reasonable prices. Inside the place is decorated cute. Nice and clean. Will definitely be back when we are in town.

ZAhmENFjLDjCJjoabS5xtg.text: Great fajitas! Prompt delivery and friendly service! I'll be ordering again, for sure! Portions were very generous, and home-made tortillas were a bonus!

q1mY4EbtwI--Sey6qK0FSg.text: Update: we decided to give it another go and quite happy I did, this is the food I once remembered for great quality! Perhaps the red chili is not what I remember, certainly it was not a dish I revisited this time. The green chili was da bomb as was the white enchiladas. We did try the queso, it was the same recipe but this time much thicker, it really did hold on to the chip. And of course the margies were on point! As always, the servers are top quality making this an overall really good restaurant.   I returned to the Valley a few months back, Ajo Al's was on my top list of return to restaurants as it was my top place to go to while I lived here before. Sadly it's not the same. I had a dish with red sauce which was so overpowering I couldn't even eat it. I mean it was inedible. My friend had the same dish and he couldn't eat his either.   We also ordered the queso, fantastic flavor but it was so runny just like water. It needed a bit of thickener so the cheese would stay on the chip.   Lastly, the best part of the meal...I had the prickly pear margarita which was amazing! My friend had a regular and that thing was loaded with the tequila!   Moral of the story...return for Marje's next time!

S2CbK2XrwbGkVIDTADYfuw.text: Great service... tasty food And awesome margaritas. Place is very comfortable and noise level is moderate so conversation is easy. Look forward to next visit.

g7Eo0YxXRQsO2hBKr7IOdA.text: Great place great service I love deep fried shredded beef tacos. Tequila selection well stocked

8ja8yKmM4GA2JdIw6pB4Tw.text: I was looking for a different place to have Mexican food near my house.  We eat out a lot and were kind of burned out on the normal restaurants in the area so we were looking for some place different.  We used to eat at Ajo Al's pretty regularly up until the early to mid 2000's when the place started to go down hill.  It was late and we needed to eat so we decided to give it a try again.  I am so glad we did. The service was the first thing I noticed that had changed.  It was 8:30pm and the restaurant closed at 9:00 but the gal that waited on us didn't rush us and she was so good at her job.  Friendly, not pushy even thou it was late.  She was awesome.  We got queso dip to go with the chips and salsa.  We needed instant gratification & it came out quickly and hit the spot.  It was Tuesday & they had taco specials going on.  I ordered one each of the  smoked meat tacos - carnitas, brisket and pork belly - with rice and beans.  The tacos were very good and again this is a half hour before they close.  The pork belly was my favorite - great smokey flavor.  Everyone at our table loved their meal and the service.  We have been back several times since that night and it has been consistently good.  Kudos to Ajo Al's for looking at their business and making the changes.  I only wish I had known sooner.

E3HQ9H1zg9Bj7tYqQEd37w.text: Big portions. I had the Picado Dinner - it wash average as it was missing some flair and savory kicks like cilantro and chili peppers. Their avocado and salsa was good and made fresh!

Sih4fbRhJzA7fi6dSCK1Cg.text: This place was awful.  Tjey can't possibly pass health inspections.  It was practically empty yet we waited over 30 minutes for our order.  The tamale was extremely dry, too dry to eat.  The taco was a hard premade cold taco shell, with just lettuce and a little bit of dry cold chicken.  No cheese, no spice, nothing.  The service and food were disgusting both!  There were also flies that kept landing on the plates. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!!

ca9M7EEElmLVovfjfrmD1Q.text: Ajo Al's on 16th St. Always our go-to place. Great food and margaritas. Glad our Bry Metz is back! We missed our favorite employee

6yTCtZPZQc8X5hmMl25BlA.text: We have been eating at the 90th street location for 23 years and just had the worst experience ever.  It took us at least a half hour to get our food.  We were told that the kitchen was backed up, but when our food came, it was lukewarm so it must have been sitting for a while.  The plates weren't even hot.  Usually you can't touch the plates without getting burned.    We didn't dare send it back and have to wait another half hour.  The dessert we ordered to go also took another 10-15 minutes.  Very disappointing!

qypN5WaauEiZg5kuFY7lpQ.text: Although our waiter was tight lipped and unsmiling we enjoyed our meal and the time spent in this nice restaurant. The Huvevos Rancheros was served very differently in two small plates rather than one plate but I enjoyed it. The chili renellos was perfectly done and flavorful as were the shrimps. ZQYTvUudne69YM-8pLBSwQ.text: This is the best place for pizza, pizza of the North that is. That pizza with the chicken and white sauce is the greatest taste together don't trust me try it for yourself.

LzsRkCzx9J6x4HRJttjEjQ.text: A favorite of my family's. The Mexican Pizza is amazing and very affordable. I have had just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed. Also great chips and salsa

c8bTlknIvQpa1VZuBCIwvg.text: Definitely one of my favorite Mexican restaurants! I highly recommend the mushroom enchiladas with the white sauce. It's delicious! I've had Jenny as my server a few times and she's always been very sweet and is quick to get my drinks from the bar. Thank you!

tK0i6SIx0RsOtqXpXvbpUg.text: Couldn't believe how fast my takeout order was ready! I had a delicious chimichanga and loved it fundido style. Can't wait to come back.

8gXr9puube8vJP6TeIa4sQ.text: The food was decent. It isn't a place I wouldn't go out of my way to return to, however it was a standard Mexican spot with pretty good food.   The service was great and the food came up quick. The salsa was good and the chips were endless which is always a great thing to have at a Mexican spot. I just wasn't blown away by anything. 1ANVGslJJ15nNrP6BmQp5A.text: Family has been going here since the late 90's. I always get the same dish. Pollo Con Queso. The last few times we visited somethings have changed. And then- The jalapeno cream cheese on my Pollo con queso had chunks of jalapenos, not diced or smaller as usual.....Way to hot for me......

kxQDcl-Fpvl32xzotMjtuw.text: Was really craving fajitas and we have driven past this place many times, so we decided to give it a try. We got seated right away and they promptly brought out a water carafe and silverware. However, we had no glasses to drink the water out of and were told they had run out of water glasses. About 10 minutes later we got some glasses for water. We both got fajitas, mine was all chicken, his was a mix of chicken and steak. My vegetables were completely raw. Very pretty in color, but completely raw. Kept stealing veggie off my fiance's skillet. Waitress was nice enough, but probably won't come back.

4z7VRfqbs1K34Rckv0SHYQ.text: What a joke! I ordered a taco salad and was given a salad with no taco. They said this was their version. BS. I have received a taco in my taco salad before at this location. Service was horrible.

KknSPgYyh3uO9gwUW9tZDg.text: Ok. Not the best Mexican food place. Thoroughly disappointed. Got the carnita taco and not what i was expecting. Maybe i am spoiled by california Mexican food. Not sure what the hype is.

hXv-0bu7xMJyCYwZc9SsMA.text: My family loves it here. It's not the fanciest and maybe I'm just sentimental but the food is consistently good and they make THE best skinny margaritas. Most places make skinny margs that taste like watered down limeade - the ones at Ajo's are full of flavor and strong. They also have some of my favorite queso in PHX.  If you're coming here for the first time - don't be intimidated by the menu. It's very busy (they need a redesign with a new graphic designer asap) but they carry all the Mexican-American basics. The service is pretty standard but it's certainly worth checking out if you're looking to try a New Mexican place.

JwNmqRdutQiM-Y3aZZ_3rQ.text: We didn't come here looking for authentic Mexican- just wanted some basic Americanized Mexican take out and even with those standards we were pretty disappointed. The queso tasted more like a cream based spinach dip than cheese. The spicy bean dip was bland and not spicy. A nice tip is to mix these two together and it's pretty tasty. The rice and beans that came with our dinner was extremely dry and bland and the burros and tacos left a lot to be desired. We picked this place based on location and decent reviews but won't be back.

9fXhV5nougs9vaDG7CD2vw.text: What happened to Ajo Al's????? For 15+ years we frequented Ajo Al's @ Scottsdale & Shea. Like once a week for years. It was among the first restaurants in the Valley to start pushing the boundaries of routine Mexican food. Among the first to add a variety of seafood dishes...among the first to add a variety of vegetable options. The service was bright and prompt...the food was high quality and consistently hot and delicious. So 7 years ago (in 2010), I moved to uptown Phoenix and Ajo Al's on 16th St was close. Yay! Or so I thought. My time as a customer there started out well. Same great service, same great menu, same delicious food. I took my friends from South America and France; they still talk about the place and its great Mexican food. However, about 3 years ago, things started to slide. First, service became sloooow and inattentive. The food was not up to their usual standards. Last night, I gave Ajo Al's another shot and it was the last time. A niece was in town and craved great Phoenix Mexican food. Ajo Al's was my first choice. We walked in to a pleasant greeting from the hostess and we were quickly seated in a dining room booth near the end of the bar. Chips and salsa arrived immediately. "Could we also have hot salsa?" I ask. "Oh, we don't have hot today." is the answer. Huh? We start on the chips...cold, oily and stale. Huh? 5 minutes go by...then 10...still no water...no offer of drinks. Huh? No one is even glancing in our direction. Huh? Then, we start looking at the menu. Ajo Al's menu is now four small sad pages. The creativity and pushed boundaries are no where to be found. Many of the vegetable and seafood dishes have disappeared. So after reviewing the now minimal menu and still having no idea of who our server might be and still no water or any drink...I tell my niece we're out of here. I stop at the hostess to say "you know how long we've been here, chips immediately came but no water and no service." She looks at me and says "do you want to talk to the manager?" I say "why?." She says "maybe you can work something out." Huh? We walk and as for me, never to return. Alas, poor Al's...I once knew it well.

NvFql9_DGj7aADCy_m-mXQ.text: Good food, large portions on food however the Margaritas are small in size. The chips are really good, not a big fan on the Salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Ajo Al's Mexican Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margaritas are good, but small.

hVdFFKpuxBWMYQG2rumcCQ.text: Don't eat here! Ever! Overpriced. Dry chicken. Nasty beans. Tasted like a TV dinner. The Drinks are super weak. Nice looking restaurant tho! Just needs a new cook.

pGXBBg41ng2AtIWxN8SumQ.text: I ate here the other night with my girlfriend and we were both puzzled when the bill arrived. We couldn't believe we ordered so much and it was so delicious! Definitely coming back soon.  Oh and the spicy salsa was phenomenal!

Tacos Morango are great and so are the loaded nachos.  My husband loves the Pollo Blanco Enchiladas. Bring us a pitcher of Margaritas and we are set.

Wf7jampUSWyAXxyKgkSiWg.text: Phoenix locations.....ugh. Service was poor. Had to  ask for our food drinks. Employees could have cared less. Drinks were warm when they got around to bringing it. hWctTHERfdR9LRHvMEjT-Q.text: We came in for the first time for restaurant week. We had reviewed the specialized menu ahead of time and knew what we wanted to order. We got our margaritas, chips and guacamole, and our pizza. After completing our meal we ordered sopapillas for dessert and were really looking forward to them. After waiting awhile, the sever came to the table with flan and said that they were all out sopapillas! We were so disappointed and looking forward to them. Not only is it the beginning of the week, but IT'S RESTAURANT WEEK! don't you think they would be more prepared? Especially when they only offer two items for dessert on their restaurant week menu? Giving this 3 stars for the server being nice and the pizza was good. Docked 2 for the restaurant not being prepared and disappointing us.

ZyZkjR2a2vituEaBLGCviA.text: Free chips and salads upon arrival with refills (probably more than anyone needs-but SO GOOD), amazing shredded beef taco salad-that jalapeno ranch is the BEST!, queso is great! Sometimes comes out runny but other times it's fine. Good, even if it is runny. Christina is a great server who always goes the extra mile!   Ps. The new sugared mangos in the margs are AMAZING! (If they are new?)

UAHWbCsVVqi32rVhu8yNzw.text: I wish I loved it less. Every time I go I eat too many chips amd delicious salsa, and today was no different. Their food is great. The fundido style burrito is my favorite but my new go to is the gf chicken enchilada in white sauce. You can't go wrong at this place. I've never had a bad experience here. I definitely prefer to eat in the restaurant side and not bar side.

7aV1sIZ8O_HbK-FurNKGBQ.text: Very attentive service by waiters. I personally love their spiciest salsa, its amazing!! You can't fo wrong with the tacos, I prefer a la cart since it comes with two. The carne asada and brisket tacos are delicious. The white chicken enchiladas, fajitas and their salads are all pretty delicious as well. I've gone to this location numerous times and have never had an issue with service or the food. I totally recommend.

Pue13_prPXyy6rwjBGge5Q.text: At first I thought the parking was horrible until I saw also the parking located at the rear of the building!  Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and seated promptly.  Our waitress came by quickly to take our drink order and we also ordered queso dip.  This was very good and encouraged to to eat more chips (see below!).  I ordered the skinny margarita which I did not care for. It definitely did not taste like a "fresh" margarita so needless to say I didn't order another one.  Their tortilla chips are house made and come to the table warm...yummy! The salsa was good but a few too many chunks of pepper for my taste. But that being said we went through many chips (read 'we ate way too many') and a couple bowls of salsa!  I ordered the folded quesadilla with fajita steak. This is an appetizer so no accompaniments but I still had some to take home because of all the chips I ate!  The steak was well cooked and had a good taste.  We also ordered the Blanco something or other with mushrooms, the trio of tacos (brisket, pulled pork and carnita) and the pollo con queso. All were delicious.  Our waitress was friendly and supplied our never ending want for more chips!  We could have had our water container filled more often but I guess we could have asked too.  It was pretty quiet while we were there on a Saturday, late afternoon.  Not sure if we'd return because hubby said he likes another restaurants pollo con queso better but it might be worth a try simply for the chips!

W51SWbGzCPZYJioC0DaCYA.text: Love their friendly servers and great food. The plates are large and the menu contains traditional fare and some new takes on old favorites.

c_77ItMpcb4In8cHToTMaQ.text: Fantastic Food!  Our family absolutely loves this place.  We had no idea that it was a family owned business until we met and talked to Danny the owner.  What a great guy Danny is!!  He is so kind and hands on with your dining experience.  We are planning a big party and found out they do catering too!!  Win win!!!!!  I highly recommend you try this place especially when visiting Arizona.  All of our friends always say "hey when we get to Arizona can we go to Ajo Al's.  This is some of the best mexican food in the valley.  I highly recommend you try it.

4AkCW8WffNE64VVXRyxQNA.text: Went here for dinner and if you like cheese everything is smothered in it!  One meal we ordered had veggies on the side and they were super mushy. Waitress seemed uninterested in her job and though she got us what ever we requested, it felt like we were putting her out. Not thinking I would go back unless I wanted lots of cheese or a simple taco. Middle of the road pricing.

rnbLozp_ZUPzYfDjJdcHBQ.text: Love this restaurant! We eat here all the time. The Pollo Con Queso is the bomb and the service is always good! Highly recommend it!

4Cp86clIRdS1rHuUTvFWiw.text: Best Mexican Food in Phoenix...Always friendly staff, prompt service and very reasonable. Family run restaurant-been going here for years. Love Ajo's....

Ri7c0xAkvvVcWQf0G6MA7w.text: The food is amazing, always delicious and consistent. But the service is AWFUL. Get it to go. Have gone 3 or 4 times and every time the service seems to get worse. Went last night and on multiple occasions would go minutes without any of the 5 servers/bar staff/host on the floor. Waited 20 minutes for clean silverware and extra napkins (ended up just taking them off one of the many tables near by) there were only 4 groups in the restaurant. The waitress came back with neither of those things or an apology and we asked for the check and ate the rest at home.

dbU4O-hQy-fSF-N8auvoWA.text: Best Mexican food in Phoenix! The little manager, I think his name is Oscar, was very helpful when trying to decide what to order. Highly recommend their pollo con queso!

eH3A8FAbANnmnInYhzGung.text: I have been to the Ajo Al's in Glendale, but have only eaten the Pizza Nortena (AMAZING!) but went to the one on 16th st and Camelback and was less then pleased with, not only the service we DIDN'T get, but the food was no bueno.  Chips and salsa came immediately. Water was already on the table in a pitcher melting and sweating away, making for a not-so-pleasant mess to stick one's arm in. Salsa was blah-no flavor at all. Chips were good, but, they are chips... After sitting for 20 minutes waiting to order (two other tables sat after us, ordered and were eating already) Ordered the steak fajitas without any sides and no tortiallas. Fajitas came, with sides (what a waste) that I didnt ask for, and the fajitas were chicken, NOT the steak I had ordered, and to top it all off, they were burnt on the bottom, and continued to burn as they sizzled on the skillet they bring them on. (smokey burnt smelly mess in my opinion) Definitely won't be going back to this location ever again. Hopefully my experience isn't valley wide and I will have better luck at the Glendale one, IF I go back.

ET68m0aheSKLcsD3jxrexQ.text: Great Mexican food, good portions and reasonable prices. Staff was courteous and served in a timely manner.

HXkUjs-F2L0EGvHo4lwlnw.text: First time visitor. One of the best meals I ever had. Full of flavour and filling. Attentive friendly staff. Top spot.

gZwIiM9SScC7I8flClS1Iw.text: A year later, I'm back at Ajo Al's and still like it just as much as last time.  It's a little heavy on the salt, but whatever.   The steak Chuy's Chimi was awesome, not overcooked.  The waitress made sure to let me know it's covered in green sauce, and substituting red wasn't a problem. KUR-vjKVioXj0HJon3p_qg.text: Mediocre at best. Not too tasty. Salsa blah, beans and rice too salty. Only thing I feel confident in recommending is the Mexican pizza app w/ chicken. Big enough to share.  Other than that, the price is too expensive for the food served.

NsIj3mlNI6v3Xwu8zsX9hQ.text: This Restaurant ROCKS! Per Maricopa County public records, this restaurant received NO VIOLATIONS during a routine health code inspection of the restaurant last week. Considering the thoroughness of these inspections, and the fact that most restaurants receive at least one violation, having a perfect inspection says a great deal about this establishment. Because they are apparently doing all the right things to keep their customers safe, my nonprofit, Restaurants that Rock, wanted to write this review to highlight and recognize their efforts. Their inspection report can be viewed at: Maricopa.gov.

Xp7T4lFFps96dvRVtNrp7g.text: I had almost given up on Mexican food in Phoenix.  I tried this place on a Friday during lunch.  I had a combo meal that included a taco and cheese enchilada.  This restaurant is one of my new favorites.  The cheese enchilda was a great choice.  Excellent flavor.  The taco was also nice and crispy, and the beef had great flavor.  The chips and salsa were very good.  The salsa was not the best I have ever had, but very good.  I wish they would put the salsa in bowls.  I cant stand eating salsa off of plates.  I will definitely return to this location.  Great food and service.

luTcVx4x-Xgb_J_vwHrBFA.text: A favorite of mine. Probably the one restaurant that I've been to the most in the 10 years I've been here in Phoenix. Love the Mexican Short Stack.

R3RWse7zGuyU-McrLWYoXw.text: My husband and I go here when we want Mexican food and we love it. Great people and friendly service.

But anyhow... He handled it smoothly as silk.  This would lead me to guess they have a pretty good bar, which my friend was enjoying of course.

I thought it was a different kind of style than I am used to so I wasn't impressed.  I'd like to give it another shot before I totally condemn a place that is obviously popular, but it's back to Chuy's and Ernie's for now....
